sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"使丢脸，使受耻辱"之意。
means: disgrace ： 侧重在别人，尤其在众人面前丢脸。
humiliate ： 强调受辱者自尊心的损坏。
shame ： 指由不光彩或不道德的行为引起的惭愧感或羞耻感。
dishonour ： 有时可与disgrace换用，但前者是指因失去荣誉所致。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"丢脸，羞愧"之意。
means: shame ： 多指因非法婚烟、私生、卖国或犯法等而丢失脸面或败坏名声，使他人认为"丢脸"、"可耻"。
disgrace ： 常指失去他人的尊敬和称赞而使自己感受到的丢脸、耻辱。
embarrassment ： 多指在社交活动中所遇到的尴尬事。
dishonour ： 指失去原来享有的光荣或自尊和自重。

sentence.Network_en: I will return, find you, love you, marry you and live without shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 我会回去，找到你，爱你，娶你，活的光明正大。《赎罪》

sentence.Network_en: You've no reason to reproach yourself, no reason to feel shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 你没有理由自责，也没有理由感到惭愧。

sentence.Network_en: Her father and her brothers would die of shame.
sentence.Network_cn: 她父亲和她的兄弟们会羞愧死。

jx.jx_en_mean: disgrace or embarrass someone by outdoing or surpassing them

lj.lj_ly: she puts me to shame, she's so capable.
lj.lj_ls: 她使我觉得尴尬，她太能干了。

lj.lj_ly: Your productivity has put the rest of us to shame.
lj.lj_ls: 你的高效率使我们其他人无地自容

means.word_mean: 使失望,驯服,使恭顺,使羞愧
丢脸,悔恨,憎恨,烦乱,懊恼

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sc(e)amu (noun), sc(e)amian 'feel shame', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schamen (verb) and German Scham (noun), schämen (verb)

entry.def: Shame is an uncomfortable feeling that you get when you have done something wrong or embarrassing, or when someone close to you has.

example.ex: She felt a deep sense of shame...
They feel shame and guilt as though it is their fault...
example.tran: 他们觉得羞愧和内疚,就好像这是他们的错。

entry.def: If someone brings shame on you, they make other people lose their respect for you.

example.ex: I don't want to bring shame on the family name...
example.tran: 我不想玷污家族的名声。

example.ex: He committed suicide rather than face the shame of being linked to the scandal.
example.tran: 他选择了自杀,不愿面对牵扯进这桩丑闻所带来的耻辱。

entry.tran: 使羞愧;使惭愧;使难为情
entry.def: If something shames you, it causes you to feel shame.

example.ex: Her son's affair had humiliated and shamed her.
example.tran: 儿子的事让她感到难堪和羞愧。

entry.def: If you shame someone close to you, you make people lose their respect for that person, by behaving in an unacceptable way.

example.ex: I wouldn't shame my father by trying that.
example.tran: 我不会做那种事让我父亲丢脸。

entry.tran: 使…感到羞愧(而不得不做…)
entry.def: If you shame someone into doing something, you force them to do it by making them feel ashamed not to.

example.ex: He would not let neighbours shame him into silence...
example.tran: 邻居们试图想让他自感羞愧而从此闭口，他是不会乖乖就范的。

example.ex: Museums have now been shamed out of selling the treasures from their collections.
example.tran: 博物馆现在已经深感羞愧，不再变卖他们收藏的珍宝了。

entry.tran: 令人惋惜的事;让人遗憾的事
entry.def: If you say that something is a shame, you are expressing your regret about it and indicating that you wish it had happened differently.

example.ex: It's a crying shame that police have to put up with these mindless attacks...
example.tran: 警察得忍受这些无谓的攻击，真是太不像话了。

example.ex: They did not have enough money to adopt a child. It was such a shame.
example.tran: 他们没有足够的钱去收养一个孩子，真让人惋惜。

entry.def: You can use shame in expressions such as shame on you and shame on him to indicate that someone ought to feel shame for something they have said or done.

example.ex: He tried to deny it. Shame on him!

entry.tran: 使自惭形秽;使相形见绌;使自愧不如
entry.def: If someone puts you to shame, they make you feel ashamed because they do something much better than you do.

example.ex: His playing really put me to shame.
example.tran: 他的表演真让我自惭形秽。

means.word_mean: 1. a painful emotion resulting from an awareness of inadequacy or guilt

sentences.sentence: "one mistake brought shame to all his family"
"suffered the ignominy of being sent to prison"
"it's a pity he couldn't do it"
"he dishonored his family by committing a serious crime"

means.word_mean: 2. compel through a sense of shame;
4. surpass or beat by a wide margin

stems_affixes.word_buile: a在……,……的+shame羞愧+ed表形容词→adj.惭愧的, 羞耻的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 羞耻, 羞愧, 可耻的人[或事物]
stems_affixes.word_buile: shame羞愧→n.羞耻, 羞愧, 可耻的人[或事物]

means.word_mean: 羞愧, 羞耻, 惭愧

sentences.en: To my shame, I never did help them.
sentences.cn: 我感到惭愧的是, 我从来没有帮助过他们。

sentences.en: His bad behaviour brings shame on the whole school.
sentences.cn: 他的恶劣行为使整个学校蒙受耻辱。

means.word_mean: 可耻的人[事]; 令人惋惜的事

sentences.en: It's a shame you can't stay with us.
sentences.cn: 你不能留下来和我们在一起, 真是太遗憾了。

means.word_mean: 使感到羞愧, 使觉得丢脸

sentences.en: The class's unruly behaviour shamed the teacher.
sentences.cn: 这班学生不守规矩的行为使老师感到羞愧。

sentences.en: He was shamed by how much more work the others had done.
sentences.cn: 别人工作做得更多, 他感到很难为情。

jushi.english: To my shame,I never thanked him for his kindness.
jushi.chinese: 我感到惭愧的是对他的好意我从未表示过感谢。

jushi.english: Isn't it a shame that the rain spoiled our picnic?
jushi.chinese: 这场雨把我们的野餐给破坏了,这不是太可惜了吗?
